alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henderson; McDonough; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 9:09AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Hancock, southeastern Henderson, southern Warren and McDonough Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 909 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stronghurst to near Blandinsville to near Augusta. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Raritan and Sciota around 915 AM CDT. Good Hope around 920 AM CDT. Roseville and Fandon around 925 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bushnell, Little Swan Lake, Avon, Industry, Prairie City, Adair and New Philadelphia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
